poem:
"Richard in Winter"

The bare winter tree of history,  
Richard, gnarled branches.  
Fractured head-lines in the frost,  
illuminated by questioning moonlight.  
A public squabble-  
your nature, king?  
Murderer or manipulated?  
Not bad, at all?  
Reframed like a portrait,  
miscoloured by intent and time.  
Fights and fictions, stories  
and souls wrestle in your roots.  
There you stand, Richard, contested  
Even in your eternal winter-sleep.
